item.title: Dangerosa add a quote by Alison Smith
item.description: "Losing your faith in a world where God is all around you is a precarious business. When God shows his face on a daily basis to your friends and neighbors, it is, on some level, impossible to stop believing in Him. Instead i felt that God chose to exclude me from His world. Since i was the only one to lose faith, to stop hearing Christ's voice, i thought perhaps it was my fault that Roy had left us. I thought i was being punished for some unknown sin. I had learned early in my Catholic career that one could sin silently in one's heart. One could even sin without ever discovering what one had done or why it was wrong. What had i done, i asked myself, to make God disappear and take Roy with Him." -- Alison Smith

item.title: Dangerosa add a quote by Jacqueline Carey
item.description: "Love as thou wilt" -- Jacqueline Carey

item.title: Dangerosa add a quote by Carolyn Parkhurst
item.description: "It's true, isn't it, that each of us has two hearts? The secret heart, curled behind like a fist, living gnarled and shrunken beneath the plain, open one we use every day." -- Carolyn Parkhurst

item.title: Dangerosa add a quote by Scott Lynch
item.description: "Worst of all, the inner vault is guarded by a live dragon, attended by fifty naked women armed with poisoned spears, each of them sworn to die in Requin's service. All redheads. -You're just making that up, Jean." -- Scott Lynch

item.title: Dangerosa add a quote by Jacqueline Carey
item.description: "Let the warriors clamor after gods of blood and thunder; love is hard, harder than steel and thrice as cruel. " -- Jacqueline Carey

item.title: Dangerosa add a quote by Jacqueline Carey
item.description: "It's funny, how one can look back on a sorrow one thought one might well die of at the time, and know that one had not yet reckoned the tenth part of true grief." -- Jacqueline Carey

item.title: Dangerosa add a quote by Kim Harrison
item.description: "That's why I want you there, he said. You're unpredictable, and that can be the difference between success and failure. Most people make decisions in anger, fear, love, or obligation. You make decisions to irritate people." -- Kim Harrison

item.title: Dangerosa add a quote by Sylvia Brownrigg
item.description: "I plan to learn enough to read you like a book." -- Sylvia Brownrigg

item.title: Dangerosa add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Home is where the heart is, I thought now, gathering myself together in Betty's Luncheonette. I had no heart any more, it had been broken; or not broken, it simply wasn't there any more. It had been scooped neatly out of me like the yolk from a hard-boiled egg, leaving the rest of me bloodless and congealed and hollow. I'm heartless, I thought. Therefore I'm homeless." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Dangerosa add a quote by Anne McCaffrey
item.description: "The tears I feel today I'll wait to shed tomorrow. Though I'll not sleep this night Nor find surcease from sorrow. My eyes must keep their sight: I dare not be tear-blinded. I must be free to talk Not choked with grief, clear-minded. My mouth cannot betray The anguish that I know. Yes, I'll keep my tears til later: But my grief will never go." -- Anne McCaffrey

item.title: Dangerosa add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "See, now I don't know whether to be all 'Yay!' because you're empowered or sad because you're having delusional almost-sex with an imaginary boyfriend." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Dangerosa add a quote by Ellen Kushner
item.description: "Not being the sort to throw a book, she pounded her fist on her cushion." -- Ellen Kushner

item.title: Dangerosa add a quote by Kelley Armstrong
item.description: "You forget, darling. I <i>am</i> the local psychopath." -- Kelley Armstrong

item.title: Dangerosa add a quote by Ellen Hopkins
item.description: "I do have friends, but they don't know me, only someone I've created to take my place. Someone sculpted from ice. I keep the melted me bottled up inside. Where no one can touch her, until, unbidden, she comes pouring out." -- Ellen Hopkins

item.title: Dangerosa add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Sometimes, you read a book and it fills you with this weird evangelical zeal, and you become convinced that the shattered world will never be put back together unless and until all living humans read the book. And then there are books like An Imperial Affliction, which you can't tell people about, books so special and rare and yours that advertising your affection feels like betrayal" -- John Green

item.title: Dangerosa add a quote by T.J. Wray
item.description: "But how can I learn to live in a world that doesn’t include my brother? All my life, I’ve always been my brother’s sister; it’s part of my identity, part of who I am. My brother is part of my past; we share a common history. And we had plans for the future." -- T.J. Wray

item.title: Dangerosa add a quote by Joseph Brodsky
item.description: "There are worse crimes than burning books. One of them is not reading them." -- Joseph Brodsky

item.title: Dangerosa add a quote by Emma Donoghue
item.description: "She was with Jude so rarely that when she was, every cell of her body rang with grateful knowledge of it." -- Emma Donoghue

item.title: Dangerosa add a quote by Emma Donoghue
item.description: "Their next reunion shifted like an oasis on the horizon, and Jude couldn't plot her course. She trudged through her days, haunted by the feeling that real life was happening five thousand kilometers away." -- Emma Donoghue

item.title: Dangerosa add a quote by Sarah Moon
item.description: "Once is sometimes enough and once is sometimes necessary." -- Sarah Moon

item.title: Dangerosa add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "but for my own part, if a book is well written, I always find it too short." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Dangerosa add a quote by Elizabeth Wein
item.description: "It's like being in love, discovering your best friend." -- Elizabeth Wein
